item.description:
Heads Up!

How and Why the Amazing Human
Head Evolved to Be the Way It Is

Lecture by Daniel Lieberman

Free and open to the public

Thursday, January 27, 6:00 pm

: : :



Daniel Lieberman, Professor of Human Evolutionary Biology at Harvard, has devoted more than 20 years to asking how and why natural selection transformed ape heads into human heads. Drawing from his new book, The Evolution of the Human Head (Harvard University Press), Lieberman will explore how heads work, evolved, and why the human head is special. His answers have widespread ramifications for how we think about human evolution and the evolution of complex structures in other organisms. Geological Lecture Hall, 24 Oxford Street. Part of the Evolution Matters Lecture Series. Reception to follow. Supported by a gift from Drs. Herman and Joan Suit.
Photo by Adam Blanchette.

Learn more about Professor Daniel Lieberman. Read more about Lieberman's research and new book in Harvard Magazine.
